channel.title: Royal Marines
channel.description: Are you applying to join the Royal Marines? You are going to have questions. This is the original PRMC forum, it gives you a opportunity to chat with guys in the same position as you.

item.title: Posterior Tibial Tendon
item.author: invalid@example.com (smoggie)
item.category: General Royal Marines Joining Chit Chat
item.dc:creator: smoggie
item.content:encoded:
I've been suffering with pain on my right ankles posterial tibial tendon, I've stopped running for just under a month now and contacted my GP the other day. The advice was pretty useless I was told to just rest and take ibrofrufen. Going to phone back in a week or 2 if I'm still having problems.

While the forum is still active I thought I'd ask could this affect my medical at all? I'm fairly worried as I don't want this to get in the way of achieving my goal.

Any help on the subject and/or...

Read more

item.title: Is knee tendonitis a bar to entry?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Billy289)
item.category: Common Training Injuries
item.dc:creator: Billy289
item.content:encoded:
Patella tendonitis to be exact. Went to physio last year and I'm all recovered now. But I've also been to the physio about plantar fasciitis, achilles tendonitis, which I have all fully recovered from. A few weeks ago I went to the physio and he said I had medial tibial stress syndrome, which is science jargon for shin splints. Again, all recovered now. I'm worried about the knee thing being a bar to entry. I wish I hadn't complained to my physio about every little niggle but I like being...

Read more

item.title: Burning Shoulders
item.author: invalid@example.com (St.Michael)
item.category: General Royal Marines Joining Chit Chat
item.dc:creator: St.Michael
item.content:encoded:
Hi, I'm getting bad burning pains in my shoukder when doing push ups could this be a something to do with the impingement?

Currently can't get past 20 push ups before it starts burning any help will be much appreciated.

item.title: Shin Splints a PERMANENT bar to entry?
item.author: invalid@example.com (dolly)
item.category: Common Training Injuries
item.dc:creator: dolly
item.content:encoded:
Hi all,

I'll try to keep it brief, I was NFA'd late last year (November time) due to shin splints (I stupidly picked them up before entering training), they were minor, fractures ruled out with X-Ray, early on in training made this decision to bring it to the attention of the medical staff as I didn't want to ruin my chances by breaking a leg a couple months down the line. Anyway, was told to do a 3 month exercise diary, re-do the medical, peak flow diary etc, did it and passed them all...

Read more

item.title: Forum future
item.author: invalid@example.com (Ninja_Stoker)
item.category: Site Issues, News and Developments
item.dc:creator: Ninja_Stoker
item.content:encoded:
Just to update with regard the state of play with this site, the original Potential Royal Marines Commando forum:

It was offered (gratis) to the Corps back in June due to the fact that the site founder, @GreyWing wants to step back after creating the site, regularly updating the software, tirelessly maintaining it & hosting it, all at no cost...for 11 years.

The logic, for the forum, was to suggest Captain Naval Recruiting (CNR) Marketing take on the overheads, but the offer...

Read more

item.title: The Special Observers?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Sortezy)
item.category: Jollies Bar
item.dc:creator: Sortezy
item.content:encoded:
As always I browse the internet looking at many things but mostly things about the Armed Forces of the UK and other countries. Today I was looking at the Artillery which I have been looking into and reading a lot about recently and not to long ago I found out that you can be Commando Trained or Para Trained but I also just stumbled into something called The Special Observers... I looked further into them and they sound like a bunch of very special dudes and hard as nails almost to the point...

Read more

item.title: Bleep Test Pass Mark ?
item.author: invalid@example.com (johno4)
item.category: Training Plans and Diet Suggestions
item.dc:creator: johno4
item.content:encoded:
Hi Gents

Apologies if this has been posted before. But I know it has changed recently a few times. What is the current minimum pass level for the bleep test ? (Level 11 or Level 11.5 ?)

item.title: RMR Liverpool RROP
item.author: invalid@example.com (Andybeamo250)
item.category: RMR Section and RMR Selection
item.dc:creator: Andybeamo250
item.content:encoded:
Alright lads, just wondering if anyone knows how long the current capita response times are? My application is on hold while they review my old medical files (which they’ve had a few weeks now) I can’t seem to get in touch with them, normally on hold for an hour +! I’ve passed my medical before Christmas.

does anyone know when the next RROP is coming up for RMR Mersey? After my medical is finally signed off all I have to do is my VPJFT but I’m getting a bit nervous I’m running out of time.

item.title: Will I still pass the medical?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Billy289)
item.category: General Royal Marines Joining Chit Chat
item.dc:creator: Billy289
item.content:encoded: I understand capita can be very strict on who they pass. 4 years ago when I was I was 18 I got prescribed an antidepressant. I remember I never actually took the medication nor did I ever go back for a second prescription. I am in perfect health but will that be a problem for the medical? It was 4 years ago and I didn't even need the medication.

item.title: I got my NSRT coming up what should I expect?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Filwyr_Celtaidd)
item.category: General Royal Marines Joining Chit Chat
item.dc:creator: Filwyr_Celtaidd
item.content:encoded: As the title suggests. I would like to know what to expect and how to prepare.

item.title: Capita\tmu\waiting
item.author: invalid@example.com (Bay24)
item.category: Introductions & Welcome to the Royal Marines Site
item.dc:creator: Bay24
item.content:encoded:
I began my application back at the start of January this year, had my selection interview, eye tests and all the other bits of paper work to go with it, however when I had my triage phone call I was made TMU due to a broken hand many years ago and possible case of asthma as an infant, finally the GP off what capita has requested, the GP confirmed with me that they have sent these documents to capita, any idea how long I may be waiting to hear back from Capita or is it best to keep chasing...

Read more

item.title: Your last session/workout!
item.author: invalid@example.com (m2013)
item.category: Training Plans and Diet Suggestions
item.dc:creator: m2013
item.content:encoded:
ok thought it might be a good idea to make a thread where everyone basically posts their last run/workout/ whatever

Il start:
today I smashed back and biceps at the gym and enjoyed a good rest day cardio wise

item.title: Australian ex army
item.author: invalid@example.com (diggernet)
item.category: Introductions & Welcome to the Royal Marines Site
item.dc:creator: diggernet
item.content:encoded: Moved here 2014 and been waiting for the 5 years to tick over, 33rd birthday Oct 2020 so hoping to be in by then. Any other aussies in here? if so any extra obstacles to jump over in the recruitment process

item.title: Newly registered? How to get going...
item.author: invalid@example.com (Ninja_Stoker)
item.category: Introductions & Welcome to the Royal Marines Site
item.dc:creator: Ninja_Stoker
item.content:encoded:
Once you Register, you must first make a brief introductory post in this subforum before you can post elsewhere.

You'll be met with this error message if you try to post somewhere else first:



To make your first post, go to the Introductions/Welcome subforum then select...

Read more

item.title: Medical Advice in regards to new discovered condition
item.author: invalid@example.com (Warmrain123)
item.category: General Royal Marines Joining Chit Chat
item.dc:creator: Warmrain123
item.content:encoded:
Hello,

i am currently dealing with a potential P8 due to Osteochondritis. Firstly I’d like to know that if you are diagnosed with a potentially barring condition would you be graded P8 or something else? I mean in the sense of, I applied thinking my injury was healed yet I found out its not, should I just withdraw my application due to potentially facing a P8 or would I just get TMU?
Secondly, in case no one knows the answer, I’d like to know if there is any possibility to talking to a...

Read more

item.title: What is the difference between basic and professional training?
item.author: invalid@example.com (CaffeinatedWizard29)
item.category: POC Section
item.dc:creator: CaffeinatedWizard29
item.content:encoded:
Hi all
Just wondering what the difference is between basic and professional training is for RM officers. On the Navy website it isn't particularly specific and does not explain what the specific differences are. The differences seem fairly self explanatory, but just wondering what the specific details are.

item.title: Swimming
item.author: invalid@example.com (blackthunder71)
item.category: General Royal Marines Joining Chit Chat
item.dc:creator: blackthunder71
item.content:encoded: I was just wondering how much of an emphasis should you put on swimming in your training?

item.title: Cut off date
item.author: invalid@example.com (cyion)
item.category: POC Section
item.dc:creator: cyion
item.content:encoded: Hi, I'm looking at RM officers and I was wondering when the cut off date is for applications. I still quite a way off as I'm only 16 and I'm also looking at other options but as I'm born in June would I miss the cut-off date for POC as I'd be too young. Also is the deadline date static or does it vary year to year?
